instruction: [INST] Analyze this file to learn MacBook motherboard repair. The 'definitions' section explains key technical terms. The 'threads' section contains real-world repair discussions. Use both sections to understand and learn how to troubleshoot MacBook issues. Posts from username 'larossmann' , 'dukefawks' , and '2informaticos' are posts from trusted experts.[/INST]

definitions.820-02098: What is 820-02098? a LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-02098</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> crash after password pass
threads.message:
M1 14” with weird problem
No water damage and not any looking damage..
Mac can work perfect and suddenly it crash and or not turn on at all, or after few minutes hours, it turn on just when charger connecting, get to the password slot, type the password press enter and boom shout off…try everything, Revive, Restore, take all the flat cables..nothing, or dead and not turn on, or turn on and crash after password, or working great until next time 🤷🏻‍♂️
Any idea?!?

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-02098</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> crash after password pass
threads.message: Did you test in safe mode?

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-02098</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> crash after password pass
threads.message:
yes,the same..
after it shout off its show 5V 0A(PPBUS 12v) until i disconnect the battery and connect again and it turn on when i connect the charger..and the after the password enter its off again..

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-02098</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> crash after password pass
threads.message: Go to Apple if is still covered by warranty...

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-02098</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> crash after password pass
